trans-unit.source: Binomial Distribution Suite | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Binomial Distribution Suite | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Binomial Distribution Suite
trans-unit.target: Binomial Distribution Suite

trans-unit.source: The Binomial Distribution Suite is a set of sample web services ([Binomial Generator](https://datamarket.azure.com/dataset/amllabs/bdg5), [Probability Calculator]( https://datamarket.azure.com/dataset/amllabs/bdp4), Quantile Calculator) that help in generating and dealing with binomial distributions.
trans-unit.target: The Binomial Distribution Suite is a set of sample web services ([Binomial Generator](https://datamarket.azure.com/dataset/amllabs/bdg5), [Probability Calculator]( https://datamarket.azure.com/dataset/amllabs/bdp4), Quantile Calculator) that help in generating and dealing with binomial distributions.

trans-unit.source: The services allow generating a binomial distribution sequence of any length, calculating quantiles out of given probability and calculating probability from a given quantile.
trans-unit.target: The services allow generating a binomial distribution sequence of any length, calculating quantiles out of given probability and calculating probability from a given quantile.

trans-unit.source: Each of the services emits different outputs based on the selected service (see description below).
trans-unit.target: Each of the services emits different outputs based on the selected service (see description below).

trans-unit.source: The Binomial Distribution Suite is based on the R functions qbinom, rbinom, and pbinom, which are included in the R stats package.
trans-unit.target: The Binomial Distribution Suite is based on the R functions qbinom, rbinom, and pbinom, which are included in the R stats package.

trans-unit.source: These web services could be consumed by users – potentially directly on the marketplace, through a mobile app, through a website, or even on a local computer, for example.
trans-unit.target: These web services could be consumed by users – potentially directly on the marketplace, through a mobile app, through a website, or even on a local computer, for example.

trans-unit.source: But the purpose of the web service is also to serve as an example of how Azure Machine Learning can be used to create web services on top of R code.
trans-unit.target: But the purpose of the web service is also to serve as an example of how Azure Machine Learning can be used to create web services on top of R code.

trans-unit.source: With just a few lines of R code and clicks of a button within Azure Machine Learning Studio, an experiment can be created with R code and published as a web service.
trans-unit.target: With just a few lines of R code and clicks of a button within Azure Machine Learning Studio, an experiment can be created with R code and published as a web service.

trans-unit.source: The web service can then be published to the Azure Marketplace and consumed by users and devices across the world – no infrastructure setup by the author of the web service is required.
trans-unit.target: The web service can then be published to the Azure Marketplace and consumed by users and devices across the world – no infrastructure setup by the author of the web service is required.

trans-unit.source: The Binomial Distribution Suite includes the following 3 services.
trans-unit.target: The Binomial Distribution Suite includes the following 3 services.

trans-unit.source: This service accepts 4 arguments of a normal distribution and calculates the associated quantile.
trans-unit.target: This service accepts 4 arguments of a normal distribution and calculates the associated quantile.

trans-unit.source: The input arguments are:
trans-unit.target: The input arguments are:

trans-unit.source: p - A single aggregated probability of multiple trials.
trans-unit.target: p - A single aggregated probability of multiple trials.

trans-unit.source: size - The number of trials.
trans-unit.target: size - The number of trials.

trans-unit.source: prob - The probability of success in a trial.
trans-unit.target: prob - The probability of success in a trial.

trans-unit.source: Side - L for the lower side of the distribution, U for the upper side of the distribution.
trans-unit.target: Side - L for the lower side of the distribution, U for the upper side of the distribution.

trans-unit.source: The output of the service is the calculated quantile that is associated with the given probability.
trans-unit.target: The output of the service is the calculated quantile that is associated with the given probability.

trans-unit.source: This service accepts 4 arguments of a binomial distribution and calculates the associated probability.
trans-unit.target: This service accepts 4 arguments of a binomial distribution and calculates the associated probability.

trans-unit.source: The input arguments are:
trans-unit.target: The input arguments are:

trans-unit.source: q - A single quantile of an event with binomial distribution.
trans-unit.target: q - A single quantile of an event with binomial distribution.

trans-unit.source: size - The number of trials.
trans-unit.target: size - The number of trials.

trans-unit.source: prob - The probability of success in a trial.
trans-unit.target: prob - The probability of success in a trial.

trans-unit.source: side - L for the lower side of the distribution, U for the upper side of the distribution, or E that is equal to a single number of successes.
trans-unit.target: side - L for the lower side of the distribution, U for the upper side of the distribution, or E that is equal to a single number of successes.

trans-unit.source: The output of the service is the calculated probability that is associated with the given quantile.
trans-unit.target: The output of the service is the calculated probability that is associated with the given quantile.

trans-unit.source: This service accepts 3 arguments of a binomial distribution and generates a random sequence of numbers that are binomially distributed.
trans-unit.target: This service accepts 3 arguments of a binomial distribution and generates a random sequence of numbers that are binomially distributed.

trans-unit.source: The following arguments should be provided to it within the request:
trans-unit.target: The following arguments should be provided to it within the request:

trans-unit.source: n - Number of observations.
trans-unit.target: n - Number of observations.

trans-unit.source: size - Number of trials.
trans-unit.target: size - Number of trials.

trans-unit.source: prob - Probability of success.
trans-unit.target: prob - Probability of success.

trans-unit.source: The output of the service is a sequence of length n with a binomial distribution based on the size and prob arguments.
trans-unit.target: The output of the service is a sequence of length n with a binomial distribution based on the size and prob arguments.

trans-unit.source: This service, as hosted on the Azure Marketplace, is an OData service; these may be called through POST or GET methods.
trans-unit.target: This service, as hosted on the Azure Marketplace, is an OData service; these may be called through POST or GET methods.

trans-unit.source: There are multiple ways of consuming the service in an automated fashion (example apps are here: <linkText>Generator</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Probability Calculator</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Quantile Calculator</linkText><title></title>).
trans-unit.target: There are multiple ways of consuming the service in an automated fashion (example apps are here: <linkText>Generator</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Probability Calculator</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Quantile Calculator</linkText><title></title>).

trans-unit.source: This web service was created using Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: This web service was created using Azure Machine Learning.

trans-unit.source: For a free trial, as well as introductory videos on creating experiments and <linkText>publishing web services</linkText><title></title>, please see <linkText>azure.com/ml</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a free trial, as well as introductory videos on creating experiments and <linkText>publishing web services</linkText><title></title>, please see <linkText>azure.com/ml</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: These are very simple examples surrounding the binomial distribution.
trans-unit.target: These are very simple examples surrounding the binomial distribution.

trans-unit.source: As can be seen from the example code above, little error catching is implemented.
trans-unit.target: As can be seen from the example code above, little error catching is implemented.
